channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: McConnell expects filibuster to remain intact with Republicans winning control of the Senate
item.description: Sen. Mitch McConnell suggested that with the GOP winning the Senate majority in the 2024 elections, the filibuster will remain intact.

item.title: Fox News projects Democrat Tammy Baldwin survives tight race to hold Wisconsin Senate seat
item.description: The Fox News Decision Desk projects that Tammy Baldwin fended off a competitive challenge for her Senate seat from businessman Eric Hovde.

item.title: Democrats hoped Harris would rescue them. On Wednesday, she will reckon with her loss
item.description: Once viewed as a potential savior for the Democratic Party after Joe Biden's reelection campaign stalled, Kamala Harris and her supporters are reckoni...

item.title: It’s Unacceptable That Kamala Harris Hasn’t Yet Publicly Accepted The Results Of The 2024 Election
item.description: The Democrats’ replacement candidate has been missing in action since her Election Day loss to Donald Trump.

item.title: Biden Still Would’ve Lost To Trump, But It Would Have Been Less Embarrassing For Democrats
item.description: Former President Donald Trump mopped the floor with Kamala Harris in a blowout comeback victory Tuesday night. As of the time of this report, Trump ha...

item.title: What to Pay Attention to in the Election Results
item.description: History will conclude that the two people who could not beat Donald Trump in 2024 were the two the Democrats tried to run.

item.title: From Tweets to Trades: The Risks of Social Media in Investing
item.description: Are you able to step outside the confines of social media echo chambers to make informed investment decisions?

item.title: Veteran Tim Sheehy Ousts Three-Term Democrat Sen. Jon Tester In Montana
item.description: Veteran Tim Sheehy, endorsed by former President Donald Trump, defeated Montana's long-time Democrat Sen. Jon Tester.

item.title: Escaping the Benchmark Trap: A Guide for Smarter Investing
item.description: Is it time to eschew the benchmark trap in favor of Warren Buffett's rule, "Don't lose capital?"

item.title: Trump made stunning gains among young voters
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump made significant gains among young voters in the election, walking away with 44% support of those under 30 years of age, ...

item.title: The Media Concede Kamala’s Defeat. Now They Need To Fully Surrender If They Want To Be Spared
item.description: There won't be an apology and even as they concede Kamala's defeat, they won't do what's needed — a full and unconditional surrender.

item.title: Americans paid $100B since 2008 to access their own money. I am petitioning the Fed to end this racket
item.description: The consequences of slow payments? Profits for banks and costly workarounds for those who can least afford it.

item.title: 2 Republican incumbents lose in Georgia House, but overall Democratic gains are limited
item.description: Democrats toppled two Republican incumbents in the Georgia state House, but won't narrow the Republican majority as much as they once hoped.

item.title: Justice Department looking to wind down Trump criminal cases ahead of inauguration
item.description: The effort reflects longstanding DOJ policies that prevent them from prosecuting a sitting president.

item.title: Democrat Vicente Gonzalez wins re-election, defeating Mayra Flores in Texas
item.description: Incumbent Democrat Rep. Vicente Gonzalez Jr. ran against former Republican Rep. Mayra Flores to represent Texas' 34th Congressional District.

item.title: American interest in moving abroad is about to ‘go into overdrive.’ These are the easiest countries to immigrate to
item.description: Immigration firms expect more Americans to look into moving abroad following Tuesday's election.

item.title: Let Trump’s Resounding Victory Be the End of Lawfare
item.description: Biden should pardon Trump, as he (inevitably) pardons his son.

item.title: Retaining Top Investment Talent: Lessons Learned by Large Canadian Pension Plans
item.description: The secret sauce of Canadian pension plan returns lies in their ability to attract top talent, carefully design compensation frameworks, and adapt to ...

item.title: European Economic Sclerosis Is Here to Stay
item.description: It would seem to be only a matter of time before the euro zone experiences another round of the sovereign-debt crisis — this time centered on France a...

item.title: Kamala Harris has conceded the election to Donald Trump in a private phone call
item.description: The aide, who declined to be identified discussing a private conversation, said Harris talked about the need for a peaceful transfer of power.

item.title: McConnell cheers GOP election wins: 'It was a hell of a good day'

item.title: CEOs including Satya Nadella and Sam Altman are lining up to congratulate Donald Trump on his election victory
item.description: CEOs and business leaders took to social media to congratulate President-elect Donald Trump on his second White House victory.

item.title: Outgoing LA DA says America’s shift is ‘heartbreaking’ after losing re-election bid
item.description: LA DA Gascón said America's shift is "heartbreaking" after losing his re-election bid to former federal prosecutor Nathan Hochman early Wednesday.

item.title: Here Are The Corporate Media Meltdowns You’ve Been Waiting For
item.description: As the inevitability of Donald Trump's electoral victory became clear, leftist hysteria kicked into high gear.

item.title: Julia Roberts, Home-Wrecker, Nation-Destroyer
item.description: ‘Your Turn, Honey’ promotes a movie star’s anti-American revolt.

item.title: From Darwin to Wall Street: A Rebuttal
item.description: The problem within finance is its philosophical core; that is, the worldview upon which our analytical frameworks are based.

item.title: Can Democrats Break Out of Their Echo Chamber?
item.description: Kamala Harris and her party have no one to blame but themselves for their misfortune.

item.title: Donald Trump will make a $400,000 salary as president. His shares in Trump Media could keep him rich to the tune of $8 billion
item.description: Experts see the president-elect’s wealth growing by the day.
